title: Founded
description: The Dayville Volunteer Fire Company was founded by Byron F Barrowclough as a ‘one-man’ fire department, as a response to the Assawauga Mill’s fire brigade being unable to provide fire protection services for the Village of Dayville.

title: Incorporated
description: The Dayville Volunteer Fire Company was incorporated into a three-company operation, with B. Russell Watt as Chief.

title: District
description: The Dayville Fire District was created as a special taxing district.

title: New Station
description: A new, larger station was built facing Hartford Pike.

title: Training Center
description: The Lt. Dennis R Lemery Memorial Training Center opens, offering fire training services for the fire companies in Killingly and the surrounding areas.

title: Regional Teams
description: Regional drone, technical rescue, and rehabiltiation teams are formed to assist mutual aid partners.
